dataBase

Class Timer

  • java.lang.Object
    • dataBase.Timer

  • public class Timer
extends java.lang.Object
    This class runs in an asynchronous task which sleeps for one second and then counts -1 to the PlayerDatas.getTimer() for each player. It also handles the event of out ran time.
    Author:
    Timon Borter

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Timer(PlayerDatas playerDatas, javax.swing.JLabel label)
      Starts new asynchronous thread which runs the timer.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Timer

        public Timer(PlayerDatas playerDatas,
             javax.swing.JLabel label)
        Starts new asynchronous thread which runs the timer. Sleeps for one second and counts timer -1. If time runs out, handles the event.
        Parameters:
        playerDatas - Requires the PlayerDatas to actualize the timer
        label - Requires the main-label for JOptionPane.showMessageDialog
